semantic_title: Blindness and Visual Impairment Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 7. Chapter 7: Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa > b. Blindness

content.full_text: If "blindness" or "low vision" of both eyes is documented but the visual impairment category is not documented, assign code H54.3, Unqualified visual loss, both eyes. If "blindness" or "low vision" in one eye is documented but the visual impairment category is not documented, assign a code from H54.6-, Unqualified visual loss, one eye. If "blindness" or "visual loss" is documented without any information about whether one or both eyes are affected, assign code H54.7, Unspecified visual loss. (Evidence: pg no: 49, L34)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding blindness and visual impairment when specific visual impairment categories are not documented, with different codes based on bilateral versus unilateral involvement (Evidence: pg no: 49, L34)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use H54.3 for bilateral blindness or low vision when visual impairment category not documented (Evidence: pg no: 49, L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation indicates blindness or low vision affects both eyes but does not specify the visual impairment category, assign the unqualified bilateral visual loss code (Evidence: pg no: 49, L34)
common_applications: Bilateral low vision without detailed classification

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use H54.6- codes for unilateral blindness or low vision when visual impairment category not documented (Evidence: pg no: 49, L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation indicates blindness or low vision affects one eye but does not specify the visual impairment category, assign appropriate unilateral unqualified visual loss code (Evidence: pg no: 49, L34)
common_applications: One eye low vision without detailed classification
Single eye affected but impairment level unclear

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use H54.7 for blindness or visual loss when laterality information is not provided (Evidence: pg no: 49, L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation indicates blindness or visual loss but provides no information about whether one or both eyes are affected, assign the unspecified visual loss code (Evidence: pg no: 49, L34)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify documentation of blindness, low vision, or visual loss
Step 2: Determine if visual impairment category is specified
Step 3: If category not specified, assess laterality documentation
Step 4: For bilateral involvement, use H54.3
Step 5: For unilateral involvement, use H54.6-
Step 6: For unknown laterality, use H54.7
